 173: '''
 174: cimport cython
 175: 
 176: import numpy as np
 177: cimport numpy as np
 178: 
 179: from libcpp.map cimport map
 180: from cython.operator cimport dereference, postincrement
 181: 
 182: DTYPE8 = np.uint8
 183: ctypedef np.uint8_t DTYPE8_t
 184: 
 185: DTYPE32 = np.uint32
 186: ctypedef np.uint32_t DTYPE32_t
 187: 
 188: STUFF = "Hi"
 189: 
 190: cpdef DTYPE32_t replace_component_if_merged(DTYPE32_t component_id, map[DTYPE32_t, DTYPE32_t] merge_components):
 191:     """ Takes component_id and saved merges data, and replaces component_id with id of root component. """
 192:     while merge_components.find(component_id) != merge_components.end():
 193:         component_id = dereference(merge_components.find(component_id)).second
 194:     return component_id
 195: 
 196: @cython.boundscheck(False) # turn off bounds-checking for entire function
 197: @cython.wraparound(False)  # turn off negative index wrapping for entire function
 198: cpdef np.ndarray[DTYPE32_t, ndim=1] _get_image_colours_component_count(np.ndarray[DTYPE8_t, ndim=1] bitmap, DTYPE32_t bitmap_height, DTYPE32_t bitmap_width):
 199:     """Takes 2D numpy array with image bitmap and returns number of components per colour."""
 200:     cdef np.ndarray[DTYPE32_t,ndim=1] components = np.zeros((2*bitmap_width), dtype = DTYPE32) # we optimize for memory here(use only bitmap_width * 2 elements)
 201:     cdef map[DTYPE32_t, DTYPE32_t] component_colours # keep {component_id: colour} pairs here, if component is merged then pair is deleted
 202:     cdef DTYPE32_t current_component_id = 0
 203:     cdef map[DTYPE32_t, DTYPE32_t] merge_components
 204:     cdef DTYPE32_t min_component, max_component
 205:     cdef DTYPE32_t upper_component, left_component
 206:     cdef DTYPE32_t upper_same_color, left_same_color
 207:     #cdef DTYPE32_t current_point = 0, bitmap_size = bitmap.size
 208:     #while current_point < bitmap_size:
 209:     for current_point in range(bitmap.size):
 210:         upper_component  = left_component  = 0
 211:         upper_same_color = left_same_color = 0
 212:         # fill in "upper_component" (upper cell's component id) and
 213:         # "upper_same_color"(boolean flag - if upper cell's has same colour) variables
 214:         if current_point >= bitmap_width:
 215:             upper_point = current_point - bitmap_width
 216:             upper_same_color = bitmap[upper_point] == bitmap[current_point] # bitmap access is not very efficient here(and on line for left_same_color) but numba inspect shows good code :(
 217:             if upper_same_color:
 218:                 upper_component = components[upper_point % (2*bitmap_width)]
 219:                 upper_component = replace_component_if_merged(upper_component, merge_components)
 220:         # fill in "left_component" and "left_same_color" variables
 221:         if current_point % bitmap_width:
 222:             left_point = current_point - 1
 223:             left_same_color = bitmap[left_point] == bitmap[current_point]
 224:             if left_same_color:
 225:                 left_component = components[left_point % (2*bitmap_width)]
 226:                 left_component = replace_component_if_merged(left_component, merge_components)
 227:         else: # start of new row, so forget data about unreachable cells
 228:             pass # no clean for now
 229:             #merge_components_prev = merge_components
 230:             #merge_components = dict_uint32_uint32()
 231:         # set current cell component
 232:         if upper_same_color and left_same_color and upper_component != left_component: # merge 2 same coloured component
 233:             if upper_component < left_component: # we always merge max_component into min_component(see details in description)
 234:                 min_component = upper_component
 235:                 max_component = left_component
 236:             else:
 237:                 min_component = left_component
 238:                 max_component = upper_component
 239:             components[current_point % (2*bitmap_width)] = min_component
 240:             merge_components[max_component] = min_component # remember merge to repeat it on following row
 241:             if component_colours.find(max_component) != component_colours.end(): # forget merged element colour
 242:                 component_colours.erase(max_component)
 243:         elif upper_same_color or left_same_color: # extend neighbouring component to current cell
 244:             components[current_point % (2*bitmap_width)] = upper_component if upper_same_color else left_component
 245:         else: # new component starts here
 246:             components[current_point % (2*bitmap_width)] = current_component_id
 247:             component_colours[current_component_id] = bitmap[current_point]
 248:             current_component_id += 1
 249:         current_point += 1
 250:     # copy colour to result
 251:     cdef np.ndarray[DTYPE32_t,ndim=1] result = np.zeros((len(component_colours)), dtype = DTYPE32)
 252:     cdef map[DTYPE32_t,DTYPE32_t].iterator it = component_colours.begin()
 253:     cdef DTYPE32_t indx = 0
 254:     while(it != component_colours.end()):
 255:         result[indx] = dereference(it).second
 256:         postincrement(it)
 257:         indx += 1
 258:     return result
